bibl.title: Dicaearchus and the "Tales from Euripides".
bibl.note: The papyrus fragments of the "Hupotheseis ton Euripidou muthon" represent a work of mythography masquerading as scholarship, falsely ascribed to Dicaearchus, and probably composed in the 1st or 2nd cent. after Christ.
bibl.seg: Rusten Jeffrey S., Dicaearchus and the "Tales from Euripides".

The papyrus fragments of the "Hupotheseis ton Euripidou muthon" represent a work of mythography masquerading as scholarship, falsely ascribed to Dicaearchus, and probably composed in the 1st or 2nd cent. after Christ.
